result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc A Spiel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-5TH OR 6TH Offense, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.
Conditions of extended supervision to be determined at the discretion of the DOC.
Defendant to install the ignition interlock device for 24 months on any  vehicle owned, operated and titled in the defendant's name.
Complete an AODA assessment, Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan, and comply with any recommended treatment.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: Fine in the amount of $600.00.  All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA.
Court ordered that all costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Operating A Motor Vehicle While Under The Influence-5TH OR 6TH Offense

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marc A Spiel

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marc A Spiel in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Marc A Spiel.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 3 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION to be determined at the discretion of the DOC.

- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample
- Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 24 months.  
- Defendant to install the ignition interlock device for 24 months on any vehicle owned, operated, and titled in the defendant's name.
- Complete an AODA assessment, Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan, and comply with any recommended treatment.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $600.00; 
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Marc A Spiel in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marc A Spiel in court, appear in person with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person and Julie Knyszek appear by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.   Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Marc A Spiel in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Marc A Spiel in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marc A Spiel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
